title: Installation issue: fio
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue
```console
# Compile
$ git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/spack/spack.git
$ source spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh
$ spack compiler find
$ spack -d install fio arch=x86_64

# Run
$ spack load fio
$ spack arch
$ fio --version
```

Hi,
For some reason even if the `arch=x86_64` flag is passed the compiling flag `-march=native` is used anyway.
So:
- compiling `fio` on a Intel machine (Intel(R) Xeon(R) Platinum 8272CL CPU @ 2.60GHz), runs on Intel but on AMD (AMD EPYC 7551 32-Core Processor) returns: `Illegal instruction (core dumped)`
- compiling `fio` on an AMD machine, runs on Intel and AMD

I was under the impression that spack would manage the compiling flag based on the `arch=` flag or by detecting the architecture.

Is there a problem with the `fio` package or something internal to spack?
